marketNews.title: Indonesian Economy +5.12% YoY in 2Q25, Above Expectations
marketNews.content: Statistics Indonesia (BPS) noted that Indonesia's economic growth reached +5.12% YoY in 2Q25 (vs. 2Q24: +5.05% YoY, 1Q25: +4.87% YoY), exceeding the consensus expectation which predicted +4.8% YoY. This result positions Indonesia's economic growth for 1H25 at +4.99% YoY. For context, the government targets economic growth at the +5% YoY level based on the revised 2025 State Budget target, while Bank Indonesia's 2025 target – which has been downgraded twice – is in the range of +4.6-5.4% YoY. On a quarterly basis, Indonesia's economic growth increased by +4.04% QoQ (vs. 1Q25: -0.98% QoQ, 2Q24: +3.79% QoQ), also higher than the consensus expectation of +3.7% QoQ. From the expenditure side, 2Q25 economic growth year-on-year was supported by the gross fixed capital formation (GFCF)/investment component which grew +6.99% YoY (vs. 2Q24: +4.42% YoY, 1Q25: +2.12% YoY) driven by government capital expenditure (+30.37% YoY). Meanwhile, household consumption grew +4.97% YoY (vs. 2Q24: +4.93% YoY, 1Q25: +4.95% YoY) along with increased spending on primary needs and public mobility. Based on business fields, the manufacturing sector was the largest contributor to growth with an increase of +5.68% YoY (vs. 2Q24: +3.95%, 1Q25: +4.55% YoY) contributing 1.13 percentage point (vs. 2Q24: 0.79 percentage point, 1Q25: 0.93 percentage point), driven by palm oil products, iron, and steel. The other services sector (+11.31% YoY) and corporate services sector (+9.31% YoY) grew the fastest in 2Q25, driven by an increase in the number of recreational visitors and travel agent/tour operator activities. Spatially, Sulawesi (+5.83% YoY) and Java (+5.24% YoY) recorded the highest growth. Meanwhile, Sumatra (+4.96% YoY), Kalimantan (+4.95% YoY), Bali & Nusra (+3.73% YoY), and Maluku & Papua (+3.33% YoY) recorded growth lower than the national economic growth.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: We assess that economic growth in 2H25 will depend on several factors, namely 1) the impact of US tariffs starting in August 2025, 2) the acceleration of government spending, and 3) the trend of interest rate decreases. Investors also need to monitor the presidential speech next Friday (15/8), which may highlight priority programs for 2026.

marketNews.title: Finance Minister Sri Mulyani Issues Regulation on Interest/Margin Subsidies for Labor-Intensive Industries
marketNews.content: Minister of Finance, Sri Mulyani, issued Minister of Finance Regulation No. 55/2025 regarding the mechanism for providing interest subsidies or margin subsidies for labor-intensive industry credits, aimed at increasing business competitiveness and expanding labor absorption. In this regulation, the government will provide interest and margin subsidies for labor-intensive industry credits of 5% effective per year, but this interest amount can change by considering policies from the Policy Committee formed by the president. Recipients of interest or margin subsidies for labor-intensive industries are individuals or business entities classified in certain labor-intensive industry categories, with subsidy recipient categories and criteria to be regulated by the Ministry of Industry.

marketNews.title: India's Palm Oil Imports Down 10% MoM in July 2025, Driven by Order Cancellations Amid Surging Futures Prices
marketNews.content: A survey from Reuters showed that India recorded a decrease in palm oil imports by -10% MoM to 858,000 tons in July 2025, after reaching an 11-month high in June 2025. The decline in palm oil import volume was influenced by order cancellations made by India following the surge in Malaysian palm oil futures contract prices in July 2025.

marketNews.title: Astra Financial Records Transactions Exceeding Target at GIIAS 2025
marketNews.content: Astra Financial recorded total transactions of 2.4 trillion rupiah during the 11 days of the Gaikindo Indonesia International Auto Show (GIIAS) 2025. This value exceeded (111.5%) the target of 2.2 trillion rupiah and originated from 6,406 Vehicle Order Letters (SPK).

marketNews.title: Minister of ESDM: Government to Build 100 GW Solar Power Plants for Village Cooperatives, Full Domestic Battery Components
marketNews.content: Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Bahlil Lahadalia, stated that the government will build solar power plants (PLTS) with a total capacity of up to 100 gigawatts (GW) to meet the energy needs of the Red and White Village Cooperatives (KDMP). Bahlil conveyed that the construction will be carried out in stages, although he did not specify when the project would commence. Furthermore, Bahlil explained that the battery components in the PLTS project are planned to fully utilize domestic products. Separately, Coordinating Minister for Food Affairs, Zulkifli Hasan, mentioned that the investment value of the project could reach 100 billion US dollars, with regulations related to PLTS development in villages expected to be finalized soon.

tickerNews.title: EMTK Increases Share Ownership in SCMA Worth IDR 68 Billion
tickerNews.content: SCMA: Surya Citra Media's controller, Elang Mahkota Teknologi (EMTK), purchased approximately 325 million SCMA shares at an average price of approximately 210.6 rupiah per share between July 28 and August 4, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 68.4 billion rupiah. After this transaction, EMTK's direct ownership portion in SCMA increased from 65.67% to 66.11%.

tickerNews.title: TLKM Revises Revenue Growth Target to Flat for 2025
tickerNews.content: TLKM: Telkom Indonesia management during the 2Q25 earnings call on Tuesday (5/8) stated that the company revised its revenue growth target from low single digit to flat for 2025. In addition, the company also lowered its 2025F EBITDA margin guidance from 50-52% to approximately 50%.

tickerNews.title: PTPS Plans to Distribute IDR 6.5 Billion Interim Dividend for 2025 Fiscal Year
tickerNews.content: PTPS: Pulau Subur plans to distribute an interim dividend for the 2025 fiscal year amounting to approximately 6.5 billion rupiah or 3 rupiah per share, indicating a dividend yield of approximately 2.1% as of Tuesday (5/8). The cum date in the regular and negotiation market is August 13, 2025, while payment will be on August 27, 2025.

tickerNews.title: ACES Net Profit Falls 6% YoY in 2Q25, 1H25 Profit Below Expectation at 33% of Consensus Estimate
tickerNews.content: ACES: Aspirasi Hidup Indonesia recorded a net profit of 151 billion rupiah in 2Q25 (-6% YoY, +7% QoQ). This result brought the net profit for 1H25 to 292 billion rupiah (-20% YoY), below expectations as it equates to 33% of the consensus 2025F estimate (vs. the last 3 years: ~39%). The weak net profit in 2Q25 was pressured by a decline in gross profit margin to 46.7% (vs. 2Q24: 48.6%, 1Q25: 48%), the lowest since 4Q18 (46.5%). This figure caused operating profit to decline (-7% YoY) in 2Q25, resulting in operating profit for 1H25 reaching only 385 billion rupiah (-19% YoY) and below expectations (36% of consensus 2025F estimate). Revenue in 2Q25 was flat (+0% YoY, +0% QoQ), causing 1H25 revenue to grow +3% YoY, in line with expectations (47% of consensus 2025F estimate) but below the 2025 guidance from management which targeted +5% YoY revenue growth.

tickerNews.title: RAJA Expects LNG Infrastructure Acquisition to Conclude in 3Q25, Downstream Acquisition Due Diligence Ongoing
tickerNews.content: RAJA: Rukun Raharja President Director, Djauhar Maulidi, stated that the company's plan to acquire a company operating in the LNG infrastructure sector is expected to be completed in 3Q25. Djauhar also added that there is an acquisition plan for a company in the downstream sector, which is currently in the due diligence stage and is expected to be finalized by the end of 2025. Meanwhile, RAJA recorded a capex realization of 20 million US dollars during 1H25, equivalent to 29% of the total 2025 capex allocation. Djauhar explained that capex absorption is focused on strategic projects, such as the construction of a compressor in Sengkang, South Sulawesi, the construction of the Tanjung Batu-Samarinda fuel pipeline, and pipeline development in the West Java region.
